translation.en: -[player 1] Keep the pack together! -[players yelling]
[player 1] Come on, Arthur!
[player 2] Drive it forwards.
[player 3] Well played, Arthur.
-[boy 1] Here he comes! -[boy 2] Are you sure it's him?
translation.es: - ¡Aquí viene! - ¿Seguro que es él? MAYFAIR, LONDRES

translation.en: [reporter] Mr. Kinnaird, will the Old Etonians
take the FA Cup this year? [boy 1] Can we have an autograph?
translation.es: - ganará la Copa este año? - ¿Nos da un autógrafo?

translation.en: What of your quarter-final opponents, Darwen FC?
translation.es: ¿Qué dice de su contrincante, Darwen FC?

translation.en: What do you think? Can they stop me winning another Cup?
-Oh, no, no, no! Not at all, sir! -[boy 1] Never!
You can quote them on that.
Ah, it's a wonder your head still fits through the door.
translation.es: Me sorprende que aún pases por la puerta.

translation.en: [man] Fergus Suter, you and I are gonna make history.
translation.es: Fergus Suter, tú y yo haremos historia.

translation.en: [station attendant] Darwen. This is Darwen.
-[train whistle blows] -Come on. Let's go.
[man] I've seen how you play in Scotland.
translation.es: He visto cómo juegas en Escocia.

translation.en: Your passing game is the future of football.
translation.es: Tu juego de pases es el futuro del fútbol.

translation.en: [man] Let's talk in my office.
So...
-How you both feeling? -Ready to get started.
So long as you keep your end of the bargain.
translation.es: Siempre y cuando cumplas con tu parte.

translation.en: Food and board's all arranged, as agreed.
They're not gonna know what's hit 'em.
Who are the new lads, then?
No idea.
[man 1] Not from round here, that's for sure.
translation.es: De aquí no son, eso es seguro.

translation.en: They're not mill workers either.
[man 2] Why has Walsh gone and brought them here?
[man 3] Got our new jerseys, lads.
Finished 'em up last night.
[man 3] And youse, captain.
-There you go. -[man 4] Ready for the big game Saturday?
And one for each of the new lads.
That's all there was, Mr. Walsh. I've only done 11.
translation.es: Eso es todo, señor Walsh. Solo hice 11.

translation.en: Jones, Harris, you don't mind, do you?
I'd like to give Mr. Suter and Mr. Love a chance.
translation.es: Quisiera darles una oportunidad al Sr. Suter y al Sr. Love.

translation.en: Fergus Suter...
and Jimmy Love?
Not the Fergus Suter and Jimmy Love who play for Partick?
They don't play for Partick anymore. They're Darwen players now.
translation.es: Ya no juegan para Partick. Ahora son jugadores de Darwen.

translation.en: Mr. Walsh,
with respect, sir, Jones and Harris helped us get to the quarter-finals.
translation.es: con todo respeto, Jones y Harris nos ayudaron a llegar a cuartos.

translation.en: And these two are going to help us win the damn thing. Now, this is my mill.
translation.es: Y estos dos nos ayudarán a ganar la Copa. Es mi fábrica.

translation.en: My team.
[Walsh] Now, give 'em the jerseys.
[Walsh] Good lads.
All right.
I've put you in here.
This is nice.
[woman] Mr. Walsh was most particular.
translation.es: El señor Walsh fue muy específico.

translation.en: Which of you is Mr. Suter?
That's me.
That means you must be Mr. Love.
translation.es: Entonces tú debes ser el señor Love.

translation.en: Guilty as charged.
Does Mr. Platt work for Mr. Walsh?
translation.es: ¿El señor Platt trabaja para el señor Walsh?

translation.en: Uh, he used to. I'm a widow.
Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
-Jimmy, for the love of God, no. -What?
translation.es: - Jimmy, por el amor de Dios, no. - ¿Qué?

translation.en: [Fergus] Keep your mind on the game.
Did you know there were 43 teams in the Cup this year?
translation.es: ¿Sabías que hubo 43 equipos en la Copa este año?

translation.en: And Arthur's is one of the last eight left in.
translation.es: Y el de Arthur es uno de los últimos ocho que quedan.

translation.en: Isn't that splendid?
We're playing a mill team in the quarter-finals this Saturday, Papa.
translation.es: Jugaremos los cuartos contra un equipo de fábrica este sábado, papá.

translation.en: Really?
The quarter-finals?
Do the millhands often get that far?
translation.es: ¿Los de la fábrica suelen llegar tan lejos?

translation.en: [Arthur] No, not usually.
[Lord Kinnaird] Will you go on with this once your child arrives?
translation.es: ¿Seguirás con esto cuando nazca tu hijo?

translation.en: I hadn't given it much thought.
Did you play much sport, Papa?
I shot, of course.
I never hunted.
-I'm not against it-- -But you are against football?
translation.es: - No estoy en contra, pero... - Pero sí del fútbol.

translation.en: No, no, no, no, no.
I think it a healthy way for little boys to get fit.
translation.es: Es una manera saludable para que los niños estén en forma.

translation.en: [station attendant] All aboard!
All passengers!
Train's about to depart!
translation.es: El tren está por partir. DÍA DE LOS CUARTOS DE FINAL

translation.en: All aboard, please!
[Walsh] Only gentlemen have lifted the Cup.
translation.es: Solo los caballeros levantaron la Copa.

translation.en: Men from fine schools,
with fine clothes, fine lives.
Imagine what it would mean to see men like us lift it.
translation.es: Imagina lo que significaría que hombres como nosotros la levanten.

translation.en: That's the dream.
[Walsh] Well, I want to wake up and find it's more than a dream.
translation.es: Quiero despertarme y ver que es más que un sueño.

translation.en: To find out it's happened.
See, that's the reason I brought you to Darwen, Fergus.
translation.es: Por eso te traje a Darwen, Fergus.

translation.en: [Walsh] Wait here, lads.
[Darwen player] Stop, lads. Hold up.
What do you make of this, lads?
You'd think the Queen lived here.
Boys.
-[Darwen player] Look at these lads! -Gentlemen.
[Arthur] Welcome.
I'm, uh... I'm captain of the Old Etonians.
translation.es: Soy el capitán del Old Etonians.

translation.en: -You're Arthur Kinnaird? -That's right.
I saw you play at Hampden a few years back against Queen's Park.
translation.es: Te vi jugar en Hampden hace unos años contra Queen's Park.

translation.en: [stammers] You were good.
Well, that's high praise indeed.
translation.es: Bueno, eso es un gran elogio.

translation.en: Of course, the game's changed since your heyday.
translation.es: Claro, el juego ha cambiado desde tu apogeo.

translation.en: I mean, it has in Scotland, at least.
Must be hard moving with the times.
translation.es: Debe ser difícil avanzar con los tiempos.

translation.en: Well, now we've established that my best days are in the past,
translation.es: Ahora que establecimos que mis mejores días son pasado,

translation.en: perhaps we should get moving.
translation.es: - deberíamos ir andando. - No quise decir...

translation.en: -I never meant-- -What's your name?
translation.es: - deberíamos ir andando. - No quise decir... ¿Cómo te llamas?

translation.en: The Suter who plays for Hibernian?
Well, I used to, at any rate.
Now I play for Darwen.
It's hardly a... hardly a local team for you.
translation.es: No es un equipo local para ti.

translation.en: Jimmy and I wanted a change of scene.
translation.es: Con Jimmy queríamos un cambio de aire.

translation.en: -Jimmy? -Jimmy Love.
-He made the trip down, too. -Did he indeed?
Uh, everyone, these boys will show you to your changing rooms.
translation.es: Estos chicos les mostrarán los vestuarios.

translation.en: [Darwen player] Hurry up, lads. Suit up and boot up.
I've been through our Football Association records,
translation.es: Revisé los registros de la Federación Inglesa de Fútbol.

translation.en: and neither Fergus Suter nor Jimmy Love played for them in the previous rounds.
translation.es: Ni Fergus Suter ni Jimmy Love jugaron para ellos en las rondas anteriores.

translation.en: There's nothing in the rules that say they can't switch team members.
translation.es: Las reglas no dicen que no pueden cambiar de equipo.

translation.en: True, but why would two successful Scottish players
translation.es: Es cierto, pero ¿por qué dos jugadores escoceses exitosos

translation.en: leave Glasgow to join a tinpot mill team in Darwen?
translation.es: se irían de Glasgow para unirse a un equipo de medio pelo en Darwen?

translation.en: Clearly, they're being paid.
To play football? But that's against the rules.
translation.es: ¿Para jugar al fútbol? Pero eso es ilegal.

translation.en: Surely, no one would risk suspension from the Cup?
translation.es: Nadie se arriesgaría a ser suspendido de la Copa.

translation.en: It would explain why two players would travel from Scotland
to join a team they have no connection with.
translation.es: para unirse a un equipo con el que no tienen conexión.

translation.en: -Now, how do we prove it? -[Arthur] We don't need to.
We'll beat them today,
and they'll be knocked out the competition.
translation.es: y serán eliminados de la competencia.

translation.en: -Are we right, lads? -[players] Aye.
[Walsh] Now, remember, they're a rough team.
They'll play as a pack and try to run through you.
translation.es: Jugarán como una manada e intentarán atravesarlos.

translation.en: -[player 1] Let's go then, boys. -[player 2] Come on. Stick together.
When we get out, I lead from the front.
translation.es: Cuando salgamos, yo lidero desde el frente.

translation.en: -Come on. -[Jimmy] Fergie!
You coming?
[woman] What's all this to-do about? Playing in the quarter-finals of the FA Cup.
translation.es: - ¿Qué es todo esto? - Jugaremos en los cuartos de la Copa.

translation.en: -Really? -Yeah.
Just waiting on news from the match.
Well, I've made it, Mr. Suter,
even if my glory days are behind me.
translation.es: aunque mis días de gloria hayan quedado atrás.

translation.en: Right. Let's knock these posh bastards off the perch.
Right. Go on, lads. Let's go.
Is that it?
I suppose he's the captain, Fergus.
translation.es: Supongo que él es el capitán, Fergus.

translation.en: Stay tight.
Yep.
[Etonian player] Come on, boys. Send them back.
[Fergus] Play the ball.
[Darwen player] Come on! In tight!
-[Arthur] Take him! -[Fergus grunts]
[Darwen player] Come on now!
Game doesn't seem to have changed so very much, Mr. Suter.
translation.es: El juego no parece haber cambiado mucho, señor Suter.

translation.en: [Darwen player] Come on. Come on, boys.
[man] The Old Etonians have scored again!
-[Darwen player] There we go! -Yes!
-We got one back! -[crowd cheers]
-It's three-one! -Yes!
-[whistle blows] -[referee] Half-time!
[referee] Half-time, gentlemen.
That Kinnaird is a bloody hard man to get around.
translation.es: Kinnaird es un hombre difícil de manejar.

translation.en: We need to fight fire with fire.
They shove you, you shove 'em back. They hit you, you hit 'em back.
translation.es: Te empujan, los empujas. Te golpean, los golpeas.

translation.en: -You can't win playing at their own game. -So, what do you suggest we do instead?
translation.es: - No puedes ganar jugando su juego. - ¿Qué sugieres que hagamos?

translation.en: [Etonian] At this rate, I'm gonna be coming out.
translation.es: A este ritmo, voy a salir.

translation.en: I want five more goals this half,
translation.es: Quiero cinco goles más esta mitad,

translation.en: so we have something to celebrate at dinner.
translation.es: así lo celebramos en la cena.

translation.en: [all] Yes!
What makes you such an expert?
I'm telling you how we play in Scotland, that's all.
translation.es: Solo te digo cómo jugamos en Escocia.

translation.en: Would you listen to him?
But Marshall's the captain.
Well, Suter's the captain now.
Lads, football is not complicated.
translation.es: Chicos, el fútbol no es complicado.

translation.en: We don't always have to run the ball forward.
translation.es: No siempre tenemos que correr hacia adelante.

translation.en: I'll stay behind, and I'll play it back.
translation.es: Me quedaré atrás y jugaré desde ahí.

translation.en: Jimmy, you know what you're doing, right?
Tommy, this game is about space.
translation.es: Tommy, este juego es sobre espacio.

translation.en: I want you to go out wide on the left.
translation.es: Quiero que te abras a la izquierda. Eres el hombre más rápido del campo.

translation.en: You're the fastest man on the pitch. You're not getting a chance to show it.
translation.es: Quiero que te abras a la izquierda. Eres el hombre más rápido del campo. No has podido demostrarlo. Deja que la pelota haga el trabajo.

translation.en: [Fergus] Let the ball do the work.
translation.es: No has podido demostrarlo. Deja que la pelota haga el trabajo.

translation.en: We pass, we move, we pass again.
translation.es: Pateamos, nos movemos, pateamos otra vez.

translation.en: Space.
But that's not how we play.
Wider. Right out onto the touchline.
translation.es: Ábranse más. Justo en la línea de banda.

translation.en: Spread out.
-They've moved their formation. -Isn't that better?
We'll run right through them.
-Come on, boys! I want the same again. -[whistle blows]
-[Arthur] Same again! -Here we go, Darwen.
translation.es: - ¡Lo mismo otra vez! - Aquí vamos, Darwen.

translation.en: Yes!
[player] Get it over to him! Yeah!
It's five-four!
The ball's gone before you can put a tackle in.
translation.es: Patean la pelota antes de que los marquemos.

translation.en: Just do whatever it takes.
Come on! Come on!
[woman] It's five-five!
[referee] It's full-time, gentlemen.
-[thunder rumbling] -[referee] Full-time, thank you.
We'll take a few minutes to get fresh air into our lungs and then extra time.
translation.es: Tomaremos unos minutos para recuperarnos y luego viene el tiempo extra.

translation.en: Look, no extra time was agreed before the game.
translation.es: No se acordó tiempo extra antes del juego.

translation.en: Since when was that a rule?
It's not in Scotland.
It is here.
Come on, boys.
[Etonian player] I'm glad that's finished. That was more tiring than I expected.
translation.es: Me alegra que haya terminado. Fue más agotador de lo esperado.

translation.en: He said no to extra time.
translation.es: Dijo que no al tiempo extra.

translation.en: What's all this about? Why are we not playing extra time?
translation.es: ¿Qué es esto? ¿Por qué no jugamos tiempo extra?

translation.en: [Fergus] Because he knows they're beaten.
It'll be replayed next Saturday.
translation.es: Volveremos a jugar el próximo sábado.

translation.en: These men have been up since before dawn and traveled for hours.
translation.es: Ellos se levantaron antes del amanecer y viajaron horas.

translation.en: You expect them to do it all again?
We're here now. Let's finish it now.
Look, we can refer this to the president of the Football Association, if you prefer.
translation.es: Podemos informarle al presidente de la Federación de Fútbol, si prefieres.

translation.en: -Well, how long will that take? -Not too long.
Marindin?
He's the president of the FA? He's your bloody goalkeeper.
translation.es: ¿Él es el presidente? Es tu maldito portero.

translation.en: We're all on the board of the Football Association. Do you have a problem with that?
translation.es: Todos estamos en la junta. ¿Tienes algún problema con eso?

translation.en: Don't you?
I'm afraid extra time wasn't agreed, gentlemen.
translation.es: Me temo que no acordaron tiempo extra, caballeros.

translation.en: Those are the rules.
And rules are made to be adhered to. [Fergus] We had you beaten today.
translation.es: - Las reglas están hechas para cumplirlas. - Los vencimos hoy.

translation.en: You know we did.
If you are right,
then you'll beat us again...
next Saturday.
No, I just worry one day Arthur will come home with a broken leg.
translation.es: Me preocupa que Arthur vuelva a casa con la pierna rota.

translation.en: Well, if he does, you can be sure it won't be his own.
translation.es: Si lo hace, no será la suya.

translation.en: -[Alma laughs] -What am I missing up there?
Oh, Monkey's telling me about the game.
translation.es: Monkey me está contando sobre el juego.

translation.en: Ah, Arthur's returning the favor at this end of the table.
translation.es: Arthur le está devolviendo el favor.

translation.en: Have you told her how it ended?
[sighs] There's nothing to tell.
Well, now I'm intrigued.
[chuckles] Uh, it's not really my story.
How strange. Usually, I can't stop you talking about football.
translation.es: Qué extraño. Siempre hablas de fútbol.

translation.en: Or cricket.
Or rugby, for that matter.
translation.es: O de rugby, en todo caso.

translation.en: When it was a draw, Arthur wouldn't allow them extra time to settle it.
translation.es: Empataron y Arthur no aceptó el tiempo extra para desempatar.

translation.en: So they must come back next week. All the way from Lancashire?
translation.es: - Deben regresar la próxima semana. - ¿Desde Lancashire?

translation.en: In all the years we've been married, I believe this is the first time you've ever asked me a single question about football.
translation.es: Desde que nos casamos, es la primera vez que preguntas sobre fútbol.

translation.en: But is it true, Arthur?
We had to do what was right.
It seems rather unkind.
-Can I second that? -[Marindin] We must follow the rules.
-Or why do we have them? -Absolutely.
And if you'd agreed extra time, Darwen would've beaten you.
translation.es: Y si hubiera habido tiempo extra, Darwen los habría vencido.

translation.en: [chuckles] Don't be absurd.
Sorry, old boy, but I must agree.
translation.es: Lo siento, pero estoy de acuerdo.

translation.en: Another ten minutes and you would've been out of the Cup on your ear.
translation.es: Diez minutos más y habrían salido de la Copa.

translation.en: Are you suggesting I acted in an underhand manner?
translation.es: ¿Estás sugiriendo que actué de manera encubierta?

translation.en: Well, I think "underhand" is a bit strong.
translation.es: Bueno, decirlo así es un poco fuerte.

translation.en: Shall we say, uh, the rules were very convenient.
translation.es: Digamos que las reglas eran muy convenientes.

translation.en: Do you really think we would've been beaten by a gaggle of--
translation.es: ¿Crees que nos habría vencido una pandilla de...?

translation.en: Of what? Mill workers?
No. Professionals.
Darwen team are fielding professional players.
Paying two members of their team to play.
translation.es: Pagaron a dos miembros de su equipo para jugar y...

translation.en: But what's wrong with that?
This is a game for amateurs and gentlemen.
translation.es: Es un juego para aficionados y caballeros.

translation.en: It's our game. [laughs] Your game?
-We invented it. -[Alma] Who's "we"?
The Old Etonians?
[Arthur] Yes! As a matter of fact.
Eton, Charterhouse, Harrow. Lots of schools played a part,
translation.es: Eton, Charterhouse, Harrow, muchos colegios han participado.

translation.en: but the point is we took a raggle-taggle pastime...
translation.es: El punto es que tomamos un pasatiempo desorganizado

translation.en: with different rules wherever it was played, and we turned it into a proper game.
translation.es: que se jugaba con diferentes reglas, y lo convertimos en un juego decente.

translation.en: For gentlemen.
Heavens. Do gentlemen shout?
Ladies...
I'm catching your eye.
Shall we leave the men to their port?
translation.es: ¿Dejamos a los hombres con sus asuntos?

translation.en: Well, shall we talk about something a little less contentious?
translation.es: ¿Hablamos de algo un poco menos conflictivo?

translation.en: What? Like the Russian-Turkish War?
I feel like a fraud.
We're celebrating like we won.
We didn't win, did we?
We came nearer to winning than we ever have done before.
translation.es: Estuvimos más cerca de ganar que nunca.

translation.en: And we may yet do it Saturday.
translation.es: Y tal vez ganemos el sábado.

translation.en: Look around.
You've given these people something to believe in.
translation.es: Les has dado a estas personas algo en lo que creer.

translation.en: The game feeds the soul
when they have nothing else that does it in their life.
translation.es: cuando no tienen nada más en la vida.

translation.en: I'm gonna head back.
-Come on, it's just getting started. -Jimmy, here.
Don't drink too much.
Fergie, come on, pal. Look, what's one more beer?
translation.es: Fergie, vamos, amigo. ¿Qué es una cerveza más?

translation.en: Come on.
Well, I suppose I am allowed an opinion.
translation.es: Bueno, supongo que se me permite opinar.

translation.en: Not on things you don't understand.
translation.es: No en cosas que no entiendes.

translation.en: I think I understand perfectly.
You're afraid of them, aren't you?
Afraid?
You're afraid new teams like Darwen will take over your game.
translation.es: Temes que equipos nuevos como Darwen se apoderen de tu juego.

translation.en: You and Alfred and all the others.
translation.es: Tú y Alfred y todos los demás.

translation.en: You're scared you'll lose control of it.
translation.es: Tienen miedo de perder el control.

translation.en: That's ridiculous.
Is it?
Arthur, you're a decent man, but this game brings out the worst in you.
translation.es: Eres un hombre decente, pero este juego saca lo peor de ti.

translation.en: Makes you childish and defensive and petulant.
translation.es: Te hace infantil, irritante y te pone a la defensiva.

translation.en: Well, I'm sorry if I disappoint you.
What?
I want us to be good parents...
and to set a good example for our child.
translation.es: y un buen ejemplo para nuestro hijo.

translation.en: We will be.
Of course we will be. Why wouldn't we be?
translation.es: Así será. ¿Por qué piensas que no?

translation.en: I'm Fergus... Suter.
Oh, I know who you are.
People won't stop shouting your name.
translation.es: La gente no para de gritar tu nombre.

translation.en: I'm Martha Almond.
You should've sung in the pub tonight.
translation.es: Deberías haber cantado en el bar.

translation.en: I should get going.
I could...
I could walk you home, if you like.
See, it's like this.
I have a little girl. She's two years old.
translation.es: Tengo una niña. De dos años.

translation.en: She has no dad.
He's gone, but... I was never married to him in the first place.
translation.es: Se fue, pero nunca estuve casada con él.

translation.en: Do you still want to walk me home?
Sure.
Why not?
We got off on the wrong foot. Let me buy you another.
translation.es: Empezamos con el pie izquierdo. Déjame comprarte otra.

translation.en: I shouldn't.
But go on, then.
I'm buying, though. No arguments.
So what did Walsh offer to get you all the way down from Glasgow?
translation.es: ¿Qué te ofreció Walsh para venir desde Glasgow?

translation.en: [man] Oh, my head!
Feels good to have a man in the house again.
translation.es: Es bueno volver a tener un hombre en la casa.

translation.en: I hope you don't mind me saying, but...
translation.es: Espero que no te moleste que te lo diga,

translation.en: you've got a lovely smile.
-Sorry, I don't mean to embarrass you. -No, you didn't.
translation.es: - Lo siento, no quiero avergonzarte. - No, no lo hiciste.

translation.en: What's coming next, I wonder?
How about this?
We best get going.
Aye, we should.
-Thanks for that. -Ah, pleasure.
Oh, won't you have some breakfast?
Oh, just a piece of bread.
Gentlemen,
the situation is no longer tenable.
translation.es: La situación ya no es sostenible.

translation.en: Our mills are struggling to turn a profit,
translation.es: Nuestras fábricas luchan por obtener ganancias,

translation.en: and the banks are starting to call in their loans.
translation.es: y los bancos están reclamando sus préstamos.

translation.en: It is regrettable that the only course of action
translation.es: Es lamentable, pero el único camino a seguir

translation.en: I can see to protect our business is a wage cut.
translation.es: para proteger nuestro negocio sería un recorte salarial.

translation.en: As chairman of the guild, I must insist that we present a united front on this matter.
translation.es: Como presidente del gremio, insisto en que presentemos un frente unido al respecto.

translation.en: To do otherwise would only invite trouble.
translation.es: Hacer lo contrario solo sería un problema.

translation.en: I propose a five-percent wage cut for every worker.
translation.es: Propongo un recorte salarial del cinco por ciento para cada trabajador.

translation.en: -All those in favor. -[all] Aye!
All those against?
Nay.
Most of my workers have families.
translation.es: La mayoría de mis empleados tienen familias.

translation.en: They can barely get by as it is.
James, you know I don't like it,
translation.es: James, sabes que no me gusta,

translation.en: but the alternative is that the mills go out of business.
translation.es: pero la alternativa es cerrar las fábricas.

translation.en: [man] How will they get by then?
How many workers do you employ at your mill, Mr. Walsh?
translation.es: ¿Cuántos empleados tiene en su fábrica, señor Walsh?

translation.en: A couple of hundred?
A hundred and seventy-seven.
Across my mills, I have 3,000.
Cartwright?
Two thousand.
Two-and-a-half.
[chairman] The motion is passed.
Every member of the Cotton Masters' Guild
translation.es: Cada miembro del gremio de algodoneros

translation.en: will impose the same cut in wages.
Do you ever worry...
about whether you'd make a good father?
Not really.
I suppose I assumed...
that it would be just as it had been for my father.
And for his father before him.
I don't remember seeing much of you when I was young.
translation.es: No recuerdo verte mucho cuando era joven.

translation.en: Don't be silly.
You were brought down every evening.
I was brought down every tea time.
translation.es: Venía siempre a la hora del té.

translation.en: Or after tea, if Mama had guests,
translation.es: O luego del té, si mamá tenía invitados,

translation.en: but I don't remember your being there often.
translation.es: pero no recuerdo que estuvieras ahí a menudo.

translation.en: I was here.
You came and saw me sometimes when I was already in bed.
translation.es: Ibas a verme a veces cuando ya estaba en la cama.

translation.en: But not much.
All over this country...
all over the world,
there are children with no food and no shelter.
translation.es: hay niños sin comida y sin hogar.

translation.en: You really cannot expect me to feel much sympathy
translation.es: No puedes esperar que sienta mucha compasión

translation.en: for the childhood that you enjoyed.
So, there's nothing you would have done differently?
Don't over-complicate it.
Your role is to provide.
To be the man of the house.
translation.es: Ser el hombre de la casa.

translation.en: [Alma] Don't tell me you've quarreled again.
translation.es: No me digas que discutieron de nuevo.

translation.en: We were discussing fatherhood... as it happens.
Oh, you surprise me. [chuckles]
You wouldn't be surprised if you heard what he said.
translation.es: No te sorprendería lo que dijo.

translation.en: And you'll be happy to hear that I want to know my children better than he did.
translation.es: Te alegrará saber que quiero conocer a mis hijos mejor que él.

translation.en: I am happy.
[Alma] I'm so looking forward to becoming a mother.
translation.es: Tengo muchas ganas de ser madre.

translation.en: -They've cut wages by five percent. -[woman 1] What?
-And what's next, ten? Fifteen? -[woman 1] How will I feed my family?
translation.es: ¿Y qué sigue, diez? ¿15? - ¿Cómo alimentaré a mi familia? - Lo sé.

translation.en: -I know. -[woman 2] What?
translation.es: - ¿Cómo alimentaré a mi familia? - Lo sé.

translation.en: -It's a wage cut, five percent. -[woman] They can't do that.
translation.es: - Un cinco por ciento menos de salario. - No pueden hacer eso.

translation.en: -The mill will reopen tomorrow. -[crowd clamors]
translation.es: La fábrica volverá a abrir mañana.

translation.en: Go and spend the day with your families.
translation.es: Vayan a pasar el día con sus familias.

translation.en: -What? Why? -[worker] You've already cut our wages.
translation.es: ¿Qué? ¿Por qué? - Ya nos recortaste el salario. - No importa por qué. Lo arreglaré.

translation.en: [Walsh] It don't matter why. I'll get it sorted.
translation.es: - Ya nos recortaste el salario. - No importa por qué. Lo arreglaré.

translation.en: What about pay? We gonna get paid for today?
I can't pay you for days when the mill isn't working.
translation.es: No puedo pagar cuando la fábrica no funciona.

translation.en: -[clamoring] -[Walsh] I'm sorry.
It'll all get straightened out by tomorrow.
Please, go home.
All members of Darwen Football Club, follow me.
translation.es: Todos los miembros del equipo de Darwen, síganme.

translation.en: The bank called in a loan.
When I couldn't pay up immediately, they foreclosed on the mill.
translation.es: Como no pude pagar de inmediato, ejecutaron la hipoteca de la fábrica.

translation.en: Now, I can get the mill reopened tomorrow, but it'll take all the liquidity.
translation.es: Puedo reabrir la fábrica, pero se necesitará toda la liquidez.

translation.en: What's this got to do with us?
The train tickets to take the team back down to London, I need that money.
translation.es: Los boletos de tren para llevar al equipo a Londres. Necesito ese dinero.

translation.en: I need it to get the mill reopened and get the men back to work.
translation.es: Lo necesito para reabrir y poner a los hombres a trabajar.

translation.en: We're gonna have to forfeit the match.
How much did you waste getting this pair in? [man] What?
[Tommy] He's paying 'em to play.
-He paid 'em to leave Partick. -Wait a minute.
-I saw the money you gave Jimmy. -[Walsh] That's none of your business.
translation.es: Le diste dinero a Jimmy anoche, te vi. - No es asunto tuyo. - Y ahora estamos fuera de la Copa.

translation.en: Now we're out of the Cup 'cause you've given away our fares.
translation.es: - No es asunto tuyo. - Y ahora estamos fuera de la Copa.

translation.en: You can have it back.
-Barely a quarter of what's needed. -Maybe not.
translation.es: - Es apenas un cuarto de lo necesario. - Tal vez no.

translation.en: But whilst our wages were being cut, you were paying them to play football.
translation.es: Mientras nos recortaban los salarios, les pagabas para jugar al fútbol.

translation.en: And what would've happened if we were found out?
translation.es: ¿Qué habría pasado si nos hubieran descubierto?

translation.en: We'd be banned from the Cup for God knows how many years!
translation.es: ¡Nos prohibirían la Copa por Dios sabe cuántos años!

translation.en: -[Walsh] Enough. -You cheated.
And you made the rest of us cheat without even knowing it.
translation.es: ¡Y nos hiciste hacer trampa sin siquiera saberlo!

translation.en: I said that's enough!
So it's over?
I'm very sorry.
Come on.
We don't know that Mr. Walsh won't find the money somewhere.
translation.es: Tal vez el señor Walsh consiga el dinero.

translation.en: We've given him all day.
As it is, we'll be sleeping on the train.
translation.es: Como sea, dormiremos en el tren.

translation.en: But I--
I thought the OEs would beat us,
translation.es: Pensé que los OE nos ganarían

translation.en: and we would be sent home then, all right?
translation.es: y que nos mandarían a casa, ¿sí?

translation.en: With our tail between our legs.
translation.es: Con la cola entre las patas.

translation.en: Don't pretend that you don't care about this place.
translation.es: No finjas que no te importa este lugar.

translation.en: I seen it last night when you realized how much this meant to these people.
translation.es: Anoche viste lo mucho que esto significaba para esta gente.

translation.en: You care about them too.
I care about the money.
But we can't give up now! It's the FA Cup!
translation.es: - ¡No podemos entregar la Copa de la FA! - Se acabó.

translation.en: It is finished, Jimmy.
translation.es: - ¡No podemos entregar la Copa de la FA! - Se acabó. Jimmy.

translation.en: The mill's closed. We're not going south.
translation.es: La fábrica está cerrada. No iremos al sur.

translation.en: And I can play football for nothing back home with my family.
translation.es: Puedo jugar al fútbol gratis en casa con mi familia.

translation.en: Pack your things.
Stay.
I can't.
But you can.
I can't.
Fergie and I...
We've always been together.
He needs me. Stay till tomorrow at least.
translation.es: - Me necesita. - Quédate al menos hasta mañana.

translation.en: You don't want to travel at night.
translation.es: No es bueno viajar de noche.

translation.en: Are you coming or not? Give me a minute.
I swear to God.
You need rid of that hat before we get back.
translation.es: Tira ese sombrero antes de que regresemos.

translation.en: Folk'll have you down as a bloody Sassenach.
I don't care what they have me down as.
translation.es: No me importa lo que piensen de mí.

translation.en: Jimmy!
-[panting] You've got to come quickly. -What is it?
You'll see. Come on.
Come with me, both of you.
This is our train.
We're going home.
[Fergus] I don't understand. [Doris] Word got out Darwen would be forfeiting.
translation.es: - No entiendo. - Se supo que Darwen renunciaría.

translation.en: The town won't have it. Tom Hindle came up with the idea.
translation.es: El pueblo no lo permitirá. A Tom Hindle se le ocurrió la idea.

translation.en: We're selling subscriptions.
They can either pay weekly or all at once.
translation.es: Pueden pagar semanalmente o todo de una vez.

translation.en: The point is, we're going to the rematch.
translation.es: El punto es que iremos a la revancha.

translation.en: -Don't those people need that money? -Maybe, but they need football too.
translation.es: - ¿Esa gente no necesita ese dinero? - Tal vez. Pero también necesitan fútbol.

translation.en: -[woman] We're proud of you, lads. -[man] You're what Darwen's made of.
translation.es: - Estamos orgullosos de ustedes. - Representan a Darwen.

translation.en: [woman] Here you go.
You're short three players. The match is due to start in ten minutes.
translation.es: Te faltan tres jugadores. El partido comenzará en diez minutos.

translation.en: Well, I'm sure they won't be much longer.
You can use the dressing room if you'd like to be more comfortable.
translation.es: Pueden ir al vestuario para estar más cómodos.

translation.en: We'll be on the pitch.
If you don't have a team on time, you forfeit.
translation.es: Si no tienen un equipo a tiempo, pierden.

translation.en: [Walsh] Or you play with what you've got.
translation.es: O juegan con lo que tienen.

translation.en: You can't expect us to play when there's only eight of us.
translation.es: No pueden pretender que juguemos con ocho.

translation.en: To quote you, Mr. Kinnaird,
"Rules are made to be adhered to."
That is unless they happen not to suit you, of course.
translation.es: A menos que no les convenga, por supuesto.

translation.en: Ten minutes...
or we claim the win.
To whom will you claim the win?
To the FA committee?
The press.
Then everyone will see what good sports you gentlemen are.
translation.es: Entonces todos verán qué buenos deportistas son.

translation.en: [scoffs] Who does he think he is?
If we don't have a full team, we ought to forfeit the game.
translation.es: Sin un equipo completo, debemos renunciar.

translation.en: What?
Why?
You heard him.
We're supposed to be gentlemen.
Two more minutes and the match is ours.
translation.es: Dos minutos más y el partido es nuestro.

translation.en: They're here. All of them.
Whatever he's paying you, make sure you earn it.
translation.es: Lo que sea que te pague, asegúrate de ganártelo.

translation.en: We had them beat before.
We can do it again.
Where the hell have you been? You almost cost us the match.
translation.es: ¿Dónde estaban? Casi nos cuestan el partido.

translation.en: Now, come here.
Now, we'll win this game, if we stop them playing their way.
translation.es: Ganaremos este juego si no los dejamos jugar a su manera.

translation.en: Alfred, stay on Love. Don't give him any time on the ball.
translation.es: Alfred, marca a Love. No lo dejes tocar la pelota.

translation.en: -What about Suter? He's the real problem. -[Arthur] I'll stay on Suter.
translation.es: - ¿Qué hay de Suter? Él es el problema. - Yo lo marco.

translation.en: You leave him to me.
-All right? -[Lyttelton] All right.
-[referee] Time. -[Lyttelton] All right, gents.
[referee] Gentlemen.
[Fergus] Jimmy!
[Fergus] Cross it, Jimmy!
[Alma] Did you see what Alfred did?
It didn't seem quite right.
Maybe not, but I'm afraid there'll be a great deal more of it.
translation.es: Quizá no, pero me temo que habrá más de eso.

translation.en: [Walsh] Foul! Referee!
-Forward! -[Arthur] As a pack!
-Get off me! -[grunts]
[Walsh] Come on, Suter!
[Fergus] Together! Together!
I thought you youngsters were meant to be quicker than us older folk.
translation.es: Creía que los jóvenes eran más rápidos que nosotros.

translation.en: Hurry up! At the ball! Heads up! Heads up!
[referee] Full-time. Full-time.
That was a good game.
Did you even play?
Or did you just shadow me to stop me playing?
translation.es: ¿O solo me seguiste para que no juegue?

translation.en: There's no need to be a bad loser.
translation.es: No hace falta ser mal perdedor.

translation.en: Kinnaird can have his Cup.
Next season, it'll be ours.
If you'll stay.
Do you want me to?
Tommy Marshall thinks I'm a waste of money.
translation.es: Tommy Marshall cree que soy una pérdida de dinero.

translation.en: Well, he's wrong.
You're the only chance we've got of taking the Cup.
translation.es: Eres la única oportunidad que tenemos de ganar la Copa.

translation.en: Besides, people here, they love to watch you play.
translation.es: Además, a la gente de aquí le encanta verte jugar.

translation.en: It gives 'em hope
and pride and so much more.
You're valued here, Suter.
Come on, lads.
Let's go home.
Admit it, they won!
Can I just say, well done us.
Hear, hear!
Speech!
-Come on, Arthur, speech! -[man] Speech!
Come on.
I won't pretend I'm not jolly pleased the way things have turned out.
translation.es: No voy a fingir que no estoy contento por cómo han sido las cosas.

translation.en: [Arthur] To have beaten Darwen,
and to be once again in the semi-finals...
translation.es: y volver a estar en las semifinales...

translation.en: Excuse me.
I'm so sorry, I... I must leave you for a moment.
translation.es: Lo siento mucho, debo retirarme un momento.

translation.en: -Shall I-- -[Alma] No, no, no. Please, sit.
Enjoy the rest of dinner.
translation.es: Disfruten el resto de la cena.

translation.en: And-- And well done.
All of you.
Very well done.
Excuse me.
Please.
Have they gone?
They have, at last. [chuckles]
Ada had to put Monkey in a fireman's lock before she could get him out.
translation.es: Ada tuvo que sacar a rastras a Monkey.

translation.en: How are you feeling? Hmm?
You any better?
[sighs] No, not much better, to be honest.
No... No...
No! [whimpers]
-[Arthur] Can anybody hear me?! -No!
Somebody send for a doctor!
[Walsh] Now, we might've lost...
but the town's still proud of you.
Here's the man of the hour, Fergus Suter!
translation.es: ¡Aquí está el hombre del momento, Fergus Suter!
